Module jBomberman
Package model

Class GameCharacter

java.lang.Object
model.Entity
model.GameCharacter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<GameCharacter>, VisitorAcceptor
Direct Known Subclasses:
NonPlayableCharacter, PlayerCharacter
public abstract class GameCharacter extends Entity implements VisitorAcceptor, Comparable<GameCharacter>
A Game Character is an entity that lives and moves in the game panel but in doing so interacts with the grid. The game is born from this exchange of relationships. In fact the characters, whether players or not, will all be subtypes of this class.

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    GameCharacter.Degree
    The degrees represent the pairs of directions that identify the derived and plausible diagonal directions.

    • getProjectedSolidPoints

      public Map<CartesianCoordinate,GameCharacter.Degree> getProjectedSolidPoints(Dir dir)
      Calculate the two projected solid points determined by the input direction. If these projections belong to an area of ​​solidity of the grid then the movement should not occur.
      Parameters:
      dir - input direction
      Returns:
      Collection of the two projected solid points

    • getActualSolidPoints

      public Set<CartesianCoordinate> getActualSolidPoints()
      Calculates the 4 points that are the vertices of the rectangle that represents the area of ​​solidity of the character
      Returns:
      Set of 4 solidity points

    • getActualSolidPointsExtremePrecision

      public Set<CartesianCoordinate> getActualSolidPointsExtremePrecision()
      Calculates the points which are the vertices of the rectangle and halfway along the sides of this which represents the area of ​​solidity of the character
      Returns:
      Set of 8 solidity points
